documents.document: RT @NHSEngland: Today is International Day of the Midwife! Thank you to all our incredible midwives for the care, compassion and support
RT @JamieWaterall: Thanking all #Midwifery colleagues across the globe for everything that you do this #IDM2021 beyond #Midwives pla

#ICYMI: The latest round of our Schools Infection Survey (SIS) suggests a reduction in the percentage of secondary school pupils and staff testing positive for #COVID19 since schools reopened. Read more about the study: https://t.co/WZFg6VVj9C https://t.co/KsWlfFtbUI

Professor Isabel Oliver, Director of our National Infection Service, explains how the funding will help double our capacity to investigate vaccines for #COVID19 variants. Read more here: https://t.co/rQ2CmhcTTY https://t.co/uF3MuIDhJZ

NEW: Cutting-edge testing centre to fast-track #COVID19 variant vaccines. The government's investing 29.3m in our new testing facilities to assess the effectiveness of existing and new #vaccines against COVID-19 variants. Read more here: https://t.co/rQ2CmhcTTY
RT @DHSCgovuk: We are investing 29.3 million in new @PHE_uk labs to speed up the development of vaccines to fight variants of #COVID19
RT @GavinWilliamson: Hugely encouraging to see positive cases of COVID-19 continuing to remain low among secondary school pupils and staff.

The #COVID19 Dashboard has been updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On Tuesday 04 May, 1,946 new cases 4 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. 34,667,904 people have now received the first dose of a #vaccine 15,630,007 have received a 2nd dose. https://t.co/9AarkTj04D

Coming out of lockdown might be worrying for some of us. Worrying too much can have a big impact on the way we feel. Visit #EveryMindMatters for a range of specific tips and expert advice to help you manage feelings of anxiety: https://t.co/oVv0DEmjTQ https://t.co/UFKPJIpFRA
As we come out of lockdown, it's still really important to follow #COVID19 guidance to prevent the virus spreading. More info on our blog: https://t.co/YyiVugFJPL

If you're observing #Ramadan, getting the #COVID19 #vaccine will not break your fast. Accept the offer of a vaccine when you're invited. Find out more about the COVID-19 vaccine here: https://t.co/0uMqooTSkq https://t.co/rDJvKlaoxW
BLOG: #COVID19 #vaccines: JCVI recommendations on the use of the AstraZeneca vaccine https://t.co/oByKbpMCCa
Join the millions already #vaccinated against #COVID19. The #NHS will let you know when your #vaccine is ready for you. More info about the vaccine: https://t.co/nGXfxIM55P https://t.co/eZCrUNWBpn
RT @ONS: The Schools Infection Survey tests staff and pupils for #COVID19 across England to track the spread of the virus in schools. Rea
Lateral flow devices (LFDs) are one of the tools being used to help us detect COVID-19 and reopen society. Read more about them and how they work in our blog: https://t.co/2vyNicv3X6
RT @DHSCgovuk: Testing is playing a vital role in keeping life moving for us all. Free #COVID19 tests are available for all adults in En
BLOG: Science lessons What We Know About #COVID19 in Schools https://t.co/Uw5gx2xcrQ

The latest round of our Schools Infection Survey (SIS) suggests a reduction in the percentage of secondary school pupils and staff testing positive for #COVID19 since schools reopened. Read more: https://t.co/Ipz2475Xh5 @ONS https://t.co/YPHQyy33fp
RT @DHSCgovuk: We're making women's health a priority in future health policy. Join more than 50,000 women including @drphilippakaye, @Da

On Monday 3 May, 1,649 new cases and 1 death within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. A total of 34,588,600 people have now received the first dose of a #vaccine. https://t.co/lg8rneKXVw
Today's update to the #COVID19 Dashboard is experiencing a short delay. An update is expected soon. Please check back here.

The #COVID19 Dashboard has been updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On Sunday 2 May, 1,671 new cases and 14 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. A total of 34,505,380 people have now received the first dose of a #vaccine. https://t.co/4LaZiFcZqf
RT @isaperena: We are launching a study to assess the effectiveness of daily testing of contacts of cases of COVID-19 as an alternative to
RT @DHSCgovuk: Testing is playing a vital role in keeping life moving for us all. Free #COVID19 tests are available for all adults in En
RT @DHSCgovuk: A new study will offer daily testing to contacts of someone who has tested positive for #COVID19 It will explore if daily t

Vaccines save millions of lives every year and are the only way to eradicate disease. Vaccines have eradicated smallpox and have nearly eradicated polio. While they arent a silver bullet, vaccines are key to ending the pandemic. #VaccinesBringUsCloser #WorldImmunisationWeek https://t.co/ez1DfLWlxV

This bank holiday weekend, our Medical Director, Yvonne Doyle, urges everyone to follow the Hands, Face, Space, Fresh Air guidance as we enjoy seeing friends and family. Find out more about the guidance on our blog: https://t.co/YyiVugFJPL https://t.co/1Hq47h1dnD

The #COVID19 Dashboard has been updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On Fri 30 April, 2,381 new cases and 15 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. 34,216,087 people have now received the first dose of a #vaccine. 14,532,875 have received a 2nd dose. https://t.co/KNJX2PMICa

This bank holiday weekend, it's still really important to follow #COVID19 guidance to prevent the virus spreading. Make sure you only meet with six people or two households outdoors and remember #HandsFaceSpace. More info on our blog: https://t.co/YyiVugFJPL

NEW: Our latest Real World Public Mental Health podcast episode explores how early experiences build trust secure the best foundations for mental health throughout life. Listen on most major podcast platforms: https://t.co/xqAy80GWlO

.@DHSCgovuk are seeking views to help inform the development of the governments Womens Health Strategy. Our Medical Director, Prof Yvonne Doyle, explains why it's really important to have your say about your experience of health care. More info: https://t.co/mkYlCBmE3g https://t.co/3oOWleaKTx

If you're observing #Ramadan, getting the #COVID19 #vaccine will not break your fast. Accept the offer of a vaccine when you're invited. Find out more about the COVID-19 vaccine here: https://t.co/0uMqooTSkq https://t.co/WNVufbHhiD
Join the millions already #vaccinated against #COVID19. The NHS will let you know when your #vaccine is ready for you. More info about the vaccine: https://t.co/nGXfxIM55P https://t.co/F1Mm5syOyN

New data from @Sport_England shows how adults in England have adapted to stay physically active despite #COVID19 restrictions. Were working with Sport England on the safe return to sports after lockdown. https://t.co/8TQaiZMWXD
RT @NHSuk: If you're aged 40 or over, or if you turn 40 before 1 July 2021, you can now book your COVID-19 vaccine. https://t.co/95odTg

#ICYMI: Yesterday we published our weekly #COVID19 surveillance report. Case rates continue to be highest in those aged 10-19 years old are lowest in those aged 70-79. See the report here: https://t.co/8dYt9zEVk9 https://t.co/3oaQmHhJtw
We've published updated figures for the total number of #COVID19 #variants reported in the UK. See the data here: https://t.co/JvZC4DketK https://t.co/Pd5cFLyH1K

We would like to congratulate Sir Simon Stevens and thank him for all he has done to protect and improve the publics health. Sir Simon has been a real public health champion, a great public servant and everyone at PHE wishes him the very best wishes in his next role. https://t.co/yaH01Qi76j

Vaccines save millions of lives every year are the most effective public health intervention after clean water. While #vaccines arent a silver bullet, they are key to eradicating diseases ending the pandemic. This graphic explains how they work: #WorldImmunisationWeek https://t.co/alHxcTMrMb

The #COVID19 Dashboard has been updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On Thurs 29 April, 2,445 new cases 22 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. 34,094,048 people have now received the first dose of a #vaccine. 14,043,961 have received a 2nd dose. https://t.co/aLQrwqeMiz

Responding to our weekly #COVID19 surveillance report, our Medical Director, Yvonne Doyle, says we cannot become complacent as restrictions gradually lift. Get your #vaccine as soon as it's offered to you and remember Hands, Face, Space, Fresh Air. https://t.co/09Q0w4IDjn
Hospital admission rates for #COVID19 also remain highest in Yorkshire and the Humber. Have a look at our weekly surveillance report here: https://t.co/8dYt9zEVk9 https://t.co/bxchHhC1Rv
Hospital admissions for #COVID19 remain highest in those aged 85 and over. See our weekly surveillance report here: https://t.co/8dYt9zEVk9 https://t.co/KhZ6Ne2uVu
Our weekly #COVID19 surveillance report also shows that case rates continue to be highest in Yorkshire and the Humber. Have a look at the data here: https://t.co/8dYt9zEVk9 https://t.co/FAHt2ENVjp

This week's #COVID19 surveillance report shows that case rates continue to be highest in those aged 10-19 years old and are lowest in those aged 70-79. See the report here: https://t.co/8dYt9zEVk9 https://t.co/nce7JsMmmw
We've just published our weekly #COVID19 surveillance report. Read it here: https://t.co/8dYt9zEVk9

As we approach the bank holiday weekend, it's still really important to follow #COVID19 guidance to prevent the virus spreading. Make sure you only meet with six people or two households outdoors and remember #HandsFaceSpace. More info on our blog: https://t.co/YyiVugFJPL

We've worked with @EquallyWellUK and @NHSEngland on some new videos to support people with severe mental illness to get their #COVID19 #vaccine. Take a look here: https://t.co/ZIdKD6csnK @dremmatiffin @wendyburn @CoProNorfolk
#ICYMI: Our new research shows that one dose of #COVID19 vaccine can cut household transmission by up to half. Read more about the study here: https://t.co/y2Ps7CUxuP https://t.co/WTuzGytlbe
RT @10DowningStreet: WATCH LIVE: COVID-19 press conference (28 April 2021) Speakers: @MattHancock, Secretary of State @DHSCgovuk Pr
RT @10DowningStreet: Watch today's coronavirus press conference live on our channels at 5pm. https://t.co/3AhHqU95pK

The #COVID19 Dashboard has been updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On Wed 28 April, 2,166 new cases and 29 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. 33,959,908 people have now received the first dose of a #vaccine. 13,581,076 have received a 2nd dose. https://t.co/WzeQ0euUrE
As we gradually come out of lockdown, make sure you stick to a group of six and only meet outside. Lets take this next step safely. Full guidance here: https://t.co/jjTlOoSJyJ https://t.co/3rRXUkkZEn

All adults in England can now easily get free rapid #COVID19 tests. You can order or collect packs of tests to do at home and report your results online. Find out more: https://t.co/SxjCKKBSgX https://t.co/FhmpzsOI12

Our Head of Immunisation, Dr Mary Ramsay, says the results of the study are very encouraging, but it's still really important to practice good hand hygiene and follow social distancing guidance. Make sure you get the vaccine as soon as you are offered it. https://t.co/R7jOptJDSs

People who became infected with #COVID19 three weeks after receiving one dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech or AstraZeneca #vaccine were 38-49% less likely to pass the virus on to their household contacts than those who were unvaccinated. More info: https://t.co/y2Ps7CUxuP https://t.co/QS5LHEzKFt
NEW: Our new research shows that one dose of #COVID19 vaccine can cut household transmission by up to half. Read more here: https://t.co/y2Ps7CUxuP

The JCVI has advised that pregnant women should be offered the #COVID19 vaccine. If you're pregnant, you'll be offered the jab at the same time as the rest of the population, based on your age and clinical risk group. Find out more here: https://t.co/qNg2VjlJ2O https://t.co/zBXpcZY0Im
Join the millions already vaccinated against #COVID19. The NHS will let you know when your vaccine is ready for you. More info about the #vaccine: https://t.co/nGXfxIM55P https://t.co/wlS5Caw8sw
RT @DHSCgovuk: One in four adults have now had both doses of the #Covid19 vaccine. Find out if you're eligible to book now: https://t.co/

It's #WorldImmunisationWeek. Did you know that Messenger RNA (mRNA) vaccines are a new type of vaccine that tell our immune systems how to create antibodies that defend against a particular infection? https://t.co/3W5luoDMji

The #COVID19 Dashboard has been updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On 27 April, 2,685 new cases and 17 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK 33,843,580 people have now received the first dose of a #vaccine and 13,201,811 have received a 2nd dose. https://t.co/utfeqDj3bp
Today's update to the #COVID19 Dashboard is experiencing a short delay. Please check back here soon.

Worrying too much can have a big impact on the way we feel. Visit #EveryMindMatters for a range of specific tips and expert advice to help you manage feelings of anxiety: https://t.co/oVv0DEmjTQ https://t.co/TyWFAjFIyf

We interviewed the experts about finding the UKs dominant #COVID19 variant and the race to understand its impact. Find out the full story in our latest #DiseaseDetectives blog: https://t.co/tDUduMg2f4 https://t.co/tvMrHEOgJm

Applicants are being sought for an important SARS-CoV-2 genomic sequencing project across 7 PHE labs. The range of roles provide an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of the global effort to combat #COVID19. Search sequencing at https://t.co/jkWL4wRaT8

If you have any questions about rapid #COVID19 testing, we have updated our blog to include the latest information. Find out how to get your own lateral flow tests https://t.co/7qi6FvHthh https://t.co/dzkNg4jYug

All adults in England can now easily get free rapid #COVID19 tests. You can order or collect packs of tests to do at home and report your results online. Find out more: https://t.co/SxjCKKBSgX https://t.co/yEKJLH9jmN

During #WorldImmunisationWeek it is important to remember why vaccines are one of the best tools we have to ensure health and prosperity for communities worldwide. #VaccinesWork to bring us closer. https://t.co/vWkChawtnb
RT @DHSCgovuk: Stay safe this #Ramadan by following #COVID19 guidelines. Watch Muslim leaders and health experts including @QariAsim @DrA
RT @JamieWaterall: During #WorldImmunisationWeek, read our latest @BJNursing open access #AllOurHealth article, which explores this importa
The COVID-19 Dashboard has now been fully updated for Monday 26 April, 2021 See the data in your area at: https://t.co/qw05K5kAUg
The homepage for the #COVID19 dashboard is experiencing a delay. An update is expected soon. https://t.co/i7zW0tU5PN
Today's update to the #COVID19 Dashboard is experiencing a short delay. Please check back here soon.

During #WorldImmunisationWeek it is important to remember that vaccines are key to keeping our children safe and stopping outbreaks of diseases like measles and mumps. It is vital that children continue to receive booster and MMR vaccines during the pandemic. https://t.co/w8YyWW4dz5
RT @DHSCgovuk: It's #WorldImmunisationWeek and there's never been a more important time to be aware: Vaccines are safe Vaccines are e

The JCVI has advised that pregnant women should be offered the #COVID19 vaccine. If you're pregnant, you'll be offered the jab at the same time as the rest of the population, based on your age and clinical risk group. Find out more here: https://t.co/5txJ7U9F2d https://t.co/a91XPRDxpE

When #stroke strikes you have to think and #ActFAST. Check their Face - has it fallen on one side? Arms can they keep them raised? Speech is it slurred? Time. Its time to call 999 if you see any one of these signs. https://t.co/V8u9Qm60uY

The JCVI have advised that it's safe for pregnant women to get the #COVID19 jab. Dr Dianne Addei explains why you should get the jab if you're pregnant, especially if you are from a black, Asian, south Asian or any minority background. Find out more: https://t.co/qNg2VjlJ2O https://t.co/TalXSJNQOt
Join the millions already vaccinated against #COVID19 to protect yourself and those around you. Get more information https://t.co/nGXfxIM55P https://t.co/mOY9I2cTFx

Vaccines are a safe and effective way of protecting against disease and we must ensure that routine vaccinations are not missed while we tackle the pandemic. Want to know how vaccines work? Watch this video: https://t.co/la0uX7L4xw #WorldImmunisationWeek

The #COVID19 Dashboard is updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On Sun 25 April, 1,712 new positive cases and 11 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. 33,666,638 people have received the first dose of the #vaccine. 12,587,116 have received a 2nd dose https://t.co/w8y8UaogGv
RT @DHSCgovuk: Every vaccination gives us hope. Thank you to all of the #NHS staff, armed forces, volunteers and members of the public who

Vaccines are one of the most successful health interventions. Vaccines have eradicated smallpox have nearly eradicated polio. They have also prevented an estimated 20m cases of measles in the UK over the past 50 years. Learn more: https://t.co/vNNUXr88nh #WorldImmunisationWeek
RT @NHSEngland: If you're pregnant, you should be offered the COVID-19 vaccine when you're eligible. You'll be offered the Pfizer/BioNTech
RT @DHSCgovuk: It's #WorldImmunisationWeek and there's never been a more important time to be aware: Vaccines are safe Vaccines are e

Vaccines are key to keeping our children safe and stopping outbreaks of diseases like measles and mumps, so it is vital that childhood vaccinations are kept up to date. Read our blog on childhood vaccines here: https://t.co/EwLDdxwmqQ

The #COVID19 Dashboard is updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On Sat 24 April, 2061 new positive cases and 32 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. 33,508,590 people have received the first dose of the #vaccine. 12,071,810 have received a 2nd dose https://t.co/dPDVDazbP4

Vaccines save millions of lives every year and are the most effective public health intervention after clean water. While vaccines arent a silver bullet, they are key to eradicating diseases and ending the pandemic. https://t.co/9bzYcZlDRQ

Meeting up with friends this weekend? It's still really important to follow the guidance to prevent the spread of #COVID19. Stick to a group of six and only meet outside. Remember to wash your hands regularly, keep your distance, and wear a face covering where appropriate. https://t.co/6Gdb9ornvq

The #COVID19 Dashboard has been updated: https://t.co/XhspoyTG79 On Fri 23 April, 2,678 new cases and 40 deaths within 28 days of a positive test were reported across the UK. 33,388,637 people have now received the first dose of a #vaccine. 11,623,671 have received a 2nd dose. https://t.co/RwrAsjOIUk

The JCVI have advised that it's safe for pregnant women to get the #COVID19 jab. JCVI member and GP, Dr Maggie Wearmouth, explains why you should get the jab if you're pregnant. Find out more: https://t.co/qNg2VjlJ2O https://t.co/KYlxTQTULO
RT @DHSCgovuk: A new study from @UniofOxford and @ONS has shown: #COVID19 infections fell by 65% after a first dose of the Oxford-AstraZ

If you're observing #Ramadan, getting the #COVID19 #vaccine will not break your fast. Accept the offer of a vaccine when you're invited. Find out more about the COVID-19 vaccine here: https://t.co/0uMqooTSkq https://t.co/bL5ERumJ6J

.@DHSCgovuk are seeking views to help inform the development of the governments Womens Health Strategy. Our Medical Director, Prof Yvonne Doyle, explains why it's really important to have your say about your experience of health and care. More info: https://t.co/Pwws5oOarx https://t.co/b2sN0DwynD
Got questions about lateral flow testing for #COVID19? Our #PublicHealthMatters blog summarises all of the latest information: https://t.co/7qi6FvHthh

All adults in England can now easily get free rapid #COVID19 tests. You can order or collect packs of tests to do at home and report your results online. Find out more: https://t.co/SxjCKKBSgX https://t.co/yEKJLH9jmN

#ICYMI: Yesterday we published our weekly #COVID19 surveillance report. Case rates have fallen across all age groups. It's essential we continue to follow the guidance and remember 'hands, face, space, fresh air' to make sure this continues. https://t.co/8dYt9zEVk9 https://t.co/we7S7mZwkg
RT @DHSCgovuk: Additional surge testing enhanced contact tracing where the #COVID19 variant first identified in South Africa has been fou
We've published updated figures for the total number of #COVID19 #variants reported in the UK. See the data here: https://t.co/JvZC4DketK https://t.co/IbBEqi18JR
